docs.lead_paragraph: Elderly people with high blood pressure who took one kind of calcium channel blocker drug were nearly twice as likely to die within five years as those treated with other drugs, Federal scientists say. The drug is the short-acting form of nifedipine, which is marketed as Procardia by Pfizer Inc., and as Adalat by the Bayer Corporation.

headline.main: Risk of Death Found in Use Of Heart Drug

docs.lead_paragraph: PAIN is always real, and each person experiences it differently. For children as well as adults, physical, emotional, cultural and social factors influence how pain is experienced and how they respond to different methods of pain control. Mary K. Kachoyeanos and Margaret Friedhoff, nurses who specialize in the management of pain at Children's Hospital of Wisconsin in Milwaukee, have found that helping children to cope with pain gives them a sense of mastery and self-control that they can apply to other stressful situations as well as to future health problems involving pain.

headline.main: Personal Health;Fighting pain with child's play and imagination.
